posts.cooked:
Signal PUBLIC GROUP LIST

Hi,
I want to find ‚Äòorganic farming‚Äô signal groups in my locality.

How to see public group lists? Do they exist?

When I contact people about buying seeds, I am told to join WhatsApp organic farming groups to enquire about seed availability in locality.

Do I have to install another messenger for public groups!

I want to know how to find organic farming public groups in signal.
I searched in Google and there seems to be websites for public group lists but they don‚Äôt seem like signal website. So how to find this in signal?

Also, is there a public signal group for signal support.

Also, this support community forum link is not displayed prominently or adequately. I had to try to remember where I saw a link and try to find it. It‚Äôs not displayed in support page.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
Hello, and welcome!

confused:

Hi,
I want to find ‚Äòorganic farming‚Äô signal groups in my locality.

How to see public group lists? Do they exist?

When I contact people about buying seeds, I am told to join WhatsApp organic farming groups to enquire about seed availability in locality.

Do I have to install another messenger for public groups!

Public group discoverability isn‚Äôt currently a feature of Signal. There is a public groups topic on this forum with links to public groups but it is still a very immature list.

confused:

Also, is there a public signal group for signal support.

There is no official Signal support group. You can get unofficial support from volunteers on the forum or submit a ticket.

confused:

Also, this support community forum link is not displayed prominently or adequately. I had to try to remember where I saw a link and try to find it. It‚Äôs not displayed in support page.

This isn‚Äôt quite a ‚Äúsupport community‚Äù but support is provided by volunteers and enthusiasts. I presume they don‚Äôt advertise this forum on the official site so users don‚Äôt get confused about where to get official support.

I saw the community link under support in signal website(at the bottom), without specifically stating it wasn‚Äôt official. So I thought it was official.

I think dedicated volunteer community support is a exploitation scam by developers. No one‚Äôs time or effort is free, for there is no free food.

Thanks for your replies.

Very long back, I remember a mailing list structured complaint system where devs did reply.

Also very long back, I remember signal giving a phone number on their website or Twitter, which, if present now would be a signal support group on signal platform itself.

For a communication application, the only situation I would have to contact support on external platform, should be when their platform itself isn‚Äôt working. Not as a regular method.

So it looks like WhatsApp if I want to cultivate rice this year. I feel confused as I have been using signal as long as there‚Äôs been a smartphone in the family and I don‚Äôt really want to install WhatsApp or Telegram. I, especially, don‚Äôt want to install it right now because of the Facebook servers being down twice now for long time and I don‚Äôt know the reason.

Surely both private and public signal groups can co-exist in peace. Privacy and security even for public conversations.

Thanks for replying and sorry if this is rant-y. 2 days spent on trying to find public group list access and signal support.

The first is non-existential and the latter is a mirage.

The frustration increases when one realises this forum isn‚Äôt official either and we are only talking amongst ourselves.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
confused:

I saw the community link under support in signal website(at the bottom), without specifically stating it wasn‚Äôt official. So I thought it was official.

The devs tend to only respond on the beta testing threads, so in that way it‚Äôs official, but there is no dedicated forum team.

confused:

I think dedicated volunteer community support is a exploitation scam by developers.

Signal is a non-profit subsisting solely off of donations so, like any other charity, they need volunteers to help where they can‚Äôt hire staff.

Very long back, I remember a mailing list structured complaint system where devs did reply.

Also very long back, I remember signal giving a phone number on their website or Twitter, which, if present now would be a signal support group on signal platform itself.

I‚Äôve been using Signal for four or five years but only got involved in beta testing/the community in the last year or so, so I‚Äôm not familiar with what you describe.

confused:

The frustration increases when one realises this forum isn‚Äôt official either and we are only talking amongst ourselves.

This is the official Signal community (it uses the signal.org domain), but it is not an official support channel staffed eight hours a day by Signal employees.

confused:

So it looks like WhatsApp if I want to cultivate rice this year. I feel confused as I have been using signal as long as there‚Äôs been a smartphone in the family and I don‚Äôt really want to install WhatsApp or Telegram. I, especially, don‚Äôt want to install it right now because of the Facebook servers being down twice now for long time and I don‚Äôt know the reason.

WhatsApp has existed doubly as long as Signal and what you‚Äôre looking for is a very specialized group, so you are more likely to find what you‚Äôre looking for there. You could always start the group you need on Signal and advertise the link where it‚Äôs most appropriate to build up your group membership .

confused:

Thanks for replying and sorry if this is rant-y. 2 days spent on trying to find public group list access and signal support.

The first is non-existential and the latter is a mirage.

Support does exist, but you have to remember it is a very small organization, so this forum is where most of the immediate support is provided, and it is provided by knowledgeable volunteers that want to see Signal succeed.

Given the nature of Signal, I don‚Äôt see there ever being a public group list cultivated by them unless they start building a database of searchable group names, and there are a lot of people that would be very unhappy if that happened.

Non-profit charity = gateway and m.o. of scamsters.

Volunteers and donors should know monetary situation of any organisation they expend their time, effort or money for. Why not?

Avitus:

advertise the link where it‚Äôs most appropriate to build up your group membership

Yes, the problem arises because I think the appropriate platform to advertise the group I have created on signal is signal itself.

I would feel odd going to a different forum for a farmer group to invite them to a signal farmer group.

How would I feel if someone did that in the farmer group I have created on signal? Or someone posting another signal support fourm membership links in this forum?

Moreover, the going language over here isn‚Äôt English. The organic farming community I am trying to access are not necessarily computer users. People don‚Äôt necessarily have computers or internet over here. I don‚Äôt have either. People don‚Äôt install whatsapp, it comes pre-installed. They send messages and watch videos. They don‚Äôt necessarily know what an app is.

A farmer I contacted over phone yesterday told me to give him WhatsApp phone no. so that he can send me seed group links.
He doesn‚Äôt know what an app is or what signal is.

But I do think there would be active farmer groups on signal. It‚Äôs quite unlikely that such a group would want a private hidden profile. Only the unavailability of public list search keeps it inaccessible.

Once when I changed something in signal settings, I got a message immediately from unknown number. I can‚Äôt recall exact setting now, but it could be ‚Äòallow messages from unknown contacts‚Äô present under sealed sender in account settings now.

When strangers can already contact us, it is only giving it a contextual filter to allow people to discover public profile of public groups. Public group Messages can be made available as internet-only option.

I don‚Äôt see any difference between groups itself, just access list needs to be there. Same way people not in contact list can discover my number when I change a setting and send me sms, surely I ought to be able to contact groups should they choose so.

I am old to signal and new to farming and my known contacts are neither signal users nor farmers, hence the situation. I am also in a new place without computer or internet access (except spotty 2g tower connection). No one around is practising organic agriculture. So I have to discover these contacts through magazines. And they seem to know only WhatsApp. But groups will be there on signal. Only I can‚Äôt find them.

Every signal user wants Signal to succeed and supports them. Just by using their app they have made a choice. But signal doesn‚Äôt seem much interested in supporting them or their needs.

link_counts.title: Sealed sender settings explanation - Still useful in 2021?

posts.cooked:
Signal says they don‚Äôt want to store group name, description and member info. The server is designed so that only those with a GroupMasterKey have access to this info. When a group link is created, it provides a way to share this key.

Since the server doesn‚Äôt want to store the key, there can‚Äôt be any official list of groups that you can search. Group members can, of course, publish their group links and talk about their groups anywhere they want.

Does whatsapp really have a searchable index for groups?

(I won‚Äôt get into issues with membership leakage because of senderkeys/attachments/network analysis of message bursts here)

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
confused:

Non-profit charity = gateway and m.o. of scamsters.

Volunteers and donors should know monetary situation of any organisation they expend their time, effort or money for. Why not?

Signal isn‚Äôt just a random group of developers asking for donations. It‚Äôs a registered non-profit with the IRS (American tax service). They are effectively a ‚Äúcompany‚Äù. Their financial information is available here.

confused:

I would feel odd going to a different forum for a farmer group to invite them to a signal farmer group.

This is generally the easiest way to bring visibility to a group. I see Telegram groups advertised on Reddit etc. all the time even though you can search for groups and channels on Telegram itself.

I‚Äôd answer the rest but I can‚Äôt follow what you‚Äôve replied to because what I said isn‚Äôt

quoted.

link_counts.title: Sealed sender settings explanation - Still useful in 2021?

posts.cooked:
confused:

Surely both private and public signal groups can co-exist in peace. Privacy and security even for public conversations.

Security, yes. Privacy, probably not. Public groups are like speaking into the megaphone in a public place, which isn‚Äôt a bad thing, but it means the ‚Äúcontents‚Äù are not private. Phone numbers also (as of now, but maybe not in the future) are not ‚Äúprotected‚Äù, so public groups don‚Äôt really combine will with privacy.

confused:

When strangers can already contact us, it is only giving it a contextual filter to allow people to discover public profile of public groups.

confused:

I don‚Äôt see any difference between groups itself, just access list needs to be there. Same way people not in contact list can discover my number when I change a setting and send me sms

‚ÄúStrangers can already contact us‚Äù = they can type random phone numbers and/or search a database and send messages. Even when I type a random phone number, it doesn‚Äôt allow me to discover the contact‚Äôs name/profile in Signal.

I just don‚Äôt think it needs to be an in-app list of groupchats

@new user:
Thanks for the reply.

All public groups can have a dummy-signalUser-publicGroupBot included as default public group user with public-group key.

So this default contact is a default member of all public groups. Hence this default SignalUniversal contact has a list of all public groups.

When a user wants to search for public group list, we can send a message to this user and get a list in reply.

E g.:

I send a message ‚ÄúFarmer‚Äù to default public user in contact and I get a list of public groups who have ‚Äòfarmer‚Äô in their public group profile.

On the user level, I will only be doing a search.

This isn‚Äôt different to maintaing a list but can be implemented within the private-group private-key structure.

Blue42:

but it means the ‚Äúcontents‚Äù are not private

Security: intended recipient gets it in intended (encrypted) manner. Not accessible by unintended entities.

Privacy: identity privacy.
We can share what we want about our identity with whom we want. We can hide whatever we want from whomever we don‚Äôt approve to see certain details.

Secrecy: hidden contents.

My requirement is to get seeds.
For all I don‚Äôt know, this requirement can already be met by an existing signal farmer group.

Security should be compulsory.
Privacy should be default implementation. User can adjust as per need.
Contents are secret within a group.

I don‚Äôt see private and public groups as different.
Public groups can just have a default user in addition to the people we have invited.

This default public user is a holder of public group list.

Privacy can still be preserved as per user settings. User/Group chooses what is visible.

Avitus:

Their financial information is available here .

I can‚Äôt download it. If you viewed it and think that signal‚Äôs financial pie indeed can‚Äôt be cut in a way to have an official signal support system, and that volunteers are required, then ok for you. It‚Äôs not my time or effort.

I have tried to see it before but I can‚Äôt recall having seen it back then either. I do remember them advertising competitive salaries. I also remember them hitting their funding targets.

I think all non-profit charity are scams. Donors can be acknowledged using a token system. Public company shares are the same.

Signal using a volunteer support system doesn‚Äôt seem ok to me. Signal not even acknowledging it properly is also ‚Äònot so ok‚Äô.

Signal can be competitive with companies on the support system services as well.

That can‚Äôt really be expected to be against the ethos of a communication app.

Signal can be a safe haven for all communications. Not just this private one but not that public one.

Telegram and Reddit aren‚Äôt competing platforms for the same communication mode, i.e. messages.
But WhatsApp, Telegram and Signal are.

The farmers are already making use of a WhatsApp group. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs proper to ask them to come to my signal group from there by posting right there. And I would have to install it and use. Which itself is a problem.

Signal is advertised as the non-exploitative alternative to competitors. Then we are told to use those exploitable or exploiting apps for some communications! I can‚Äôt understand this.
posts.edit_reason: 2 posts were merged in by Herohtar

posts.cooked:
Who is supposed to control this bot? The server doesn‚Äôt want to do it because then the courts and others can ask it to do more things, provide info, etc.

It is simpler for these public groups to come to the forum and post their group link in the thread that was linked above.

confused:

The farmers are already making use of a WhatsApp group.

How do you know about this group?

confused:

When I contact people about buying seeds, I am told to join WhatsApp organic farming groups to enquire about seed availability in locality.

Is this how?

confused:

I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs proper to ask them to come to my signal group from there by posting right there.

If the farmers are interested in the money you‚Äôre going to give them then they will install the app you want.

confused:

Signal is advertised as the non-exploitative alternative to competitors. Then we are told to use those exploitable or exploiting apps for some communications! I can‚Äôt understand this.

Most people aren‚Äôt using Signal. If you want to contact them you have to find some other way. You can always limit your conversation in other mediums to asking them to install Signal, if that is what you want. What exactly do you expect from Signal here?

@newuser : yes, that‚Äôs how. I have written about this in the fifth post in this topic thread.

A farmer I contacted over phone yesterday told me to give him WhatsApp phone no. so that he can send me seed group links.
He doesn‚Äôt know what an app is or what signal is.

When I tried to send some of my points through the contact option in the Signal App> Help> Contact Us, I got a message ‚ÄòNo app can perform this action.‚Äô

Is it working for others?

I sent it again from ‚ÄòContact Us‚Äô in Support website options. It worked over there.

posts.name: Oddbyte
posts.cooked: I would like to see public groups that anyone can join and list on the discovery. These groups should still be E2EE, just have their invite link be publicly listed in some discovery feature. I think this would boost community engagement and the creation of groups focused on specific topics, as well as making already-existing public groups easier to find.

posts.name: makiro
posts.cooked:
I don‚Äôt think signal wants to get into ‚Äúsocial media‚Äù type of functionality.

The app is primarily designed for messaging, and this would open a huge can of worm with regards to moderation.

makiro:

I don‚Äôt think signal wants to get into ‚Äúsocial media‚Äù type of functionality.

I agree. However, you can find some public links online (e.g. in some forums) to join theme based groups. It‚Äôs not in app but that‚Äôs a possibility if you‚Äôre looking for some communities.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: This is unlikely to happen. The whole point of Signal is privacy. If you want to join a public conversation with complete strangers, that‚Äôs what social media is for.
